This isn't to say this applies to everyone as there have been some Democrats willing to call things out and take action but it still feels like a minority.

Comment: I understand the minority voters aspect. What I don't understand are things like Schumer not fighting the continuing resolution at all. That was the only leverage they had to try and prevent some of this and they just rolled over completely.   While they may not have the votes at the moment there are still a number of things they should be doing. AOC and Bernie are good examples of what every Democrat should be doing. They are going around and being vocal about what is happening and trying to push back. They are rallying their base for support as well as trying to bring people to their side. We've seen the damage caused from only a few months of this administration, imagine what they could accomplish in 2 years. Waiting until the mid-terms is not acceptable. Even if they think they may not have the numbers I think they should still try for an impeachment and removal. It feels as if they're giving up without even trying.  The President is a felon with an incompetent and dangerous administration. They have done more than enough to deserve being removed from their positions. Everyone should be beholden to the law and their oath of office and currently they aren't being held accountable by the people who actually have the power to do so.
Author: CarolinaBat

Comment: > What is a party with minority voting numbers in both houses supposed to do?   The answer is always "i don't know, just do something"... been thrown around for some decades with out any clear, or concise answers. Why? Its a line usually levied by complete morons, or those arguing in bad faith.   (Edit: My favorite is when they parrot back a list of "must/should do" and its what is being done already... like really...)  >From an outside observer perspective, it appears people are partially blaming those not in power for what those in power are doing.  Yes, and more often than not the ones doing so push other propaganda talking points at the benefit of those in power... as an example, "Biden old", but then refusing to address the fact that Trump is just as old and twice as senile.   None of any of that involves good faith rhetoric of any kind.
